questions.question_text: Which two steps must you perform to enable router-on-a-stick on a switch? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Connect the router to a trunk port.
choices.C: Configure an IP route to the VLAN destination network.
choices.B: Assign the access port to a VLAN.
choices.A: Configure the subinterface number exactly the same as the matching VLAN.

discussion.content:
No @aivladulescu, if you are making subinterface Gi0/0.10, you usually assign it to subnet 10.0.10.0/24 to simplify administration, but you don't HAVE TO, you can assign subnet 10.0.65.0/24 if you want.
B is true, you're doing it with the command "encapsulation dot1q 10".
D is true, if you put a trunk port on one side, an access on the other, you'll have some suprises.
A is router on stuck configuration on router. And the answer is on switch. I think B+D is correct answer

Valid answers should be A + B and not B + D, since router on a stick performed on a switch requires a Layer 3 switch and setting up the inter-vlan routing between different vlans requires SVI to be created and at least on physical port assigned (trunk/access) on that specific switch for the interface to come up.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. What is the metric for the route from R1 to 192.168.10.1?

discussion.content: D matches because EIGRP route is more specific in the RT

Eigrp [90/1] here 90 means ad where 1 is the metric in this case. 
Hence this answer is mistake to reach .1 there is .o network , 2 is the metric value

comments.content: The first number that you see between "[ ]" means the administrative distance. In this case is 90 because you're using EIGRP and the second one is the metric of that path

discussion.content: can I get explanation on answer D,cos I think its B

questions.question_text: When an interface is configured with PortFast BPDU guard, how does the interface respond when it receives a BPDU?

choices.C: It becomes the root bridge for the configured VLAN.
choices.D: It goes into an errdisable state.
choices.B: It goes into a down/down state.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
PortFast BPDU guard prevents loops by moving a nontrunking port into an errdisable state when a BPDU is received on that port.

Selected Answer: D
its go into between to

questions.question_text: Which symptom most commonly indicates that two connecting interfaces are configured with a duplex mismatch?

comments.content: A duplex mismatch will not cause a link to go down.

choices.A: an interface with a down/down status
choices.D: an interface with an up/down status

questions.question_text: Which three technical services support cloud computing? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
I do agree with int0
---------------------------------------------
Four technical services are essential to supporting the high level of flexibility, resource availability, and transparent resource connectivity required for cloud computing:
+ The Layer 3 network offers the traditional routed interconnection between remote sites and provides end-user access to cloud services.
+ The extended LAN between two or more sites offers transparent transport and supports application and operating system mobility.
+ Extended SAN services support data access and accurate data replication.
+ IP Localization improves northbound and southbound traffic as well as server-to-server workflows.

Reference: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/ios-nx-os-software/ios-xr-software/white_paper_c11-694882.html
